titleStmt.title: Edward Webster to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1955

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency,
Governor of Kentucky

The undersigned, Attorney and Counsellor-at-Law in all the Courts of the State of New York, hereby respectfully solicits the appointment of COMMISSIONER for your State, to take acknowledgements, administer oaths, and perform such other acts and duties as pertain to the aforesaid office.

Very Truly, &c.,
Edward Webster
ROCHESTER, N. Y.
Sept. 20th 1864

I Certify, That the above named applicant is a suitable and proper person, in all respects, to receive the appointment of Commissioner, and would hereby recommend him to your Excellency's favorable consideration.

B. Frank Enos
City Clerk
Comr Deeds
New York
Edward Webster
apptd
23d Sept/64
